abstracts.cdata!:
The Sustainable Communities Project in
            the State of Amapa will implement environmental protection
            actions following an integrated analysis, ensuring that
            project invested resources, foster short-, medium- and
            long-term environmental, sustainable development. The
            project has been classified as Category B in accordance with
            the Bank's operational directives, given that overall,
            project related interventions will prod positive
            environmental impacts. Nonetheless, this environmental
            assessment looks at the potential adverse impacts resulting
            from subproject construction, and production processes,
            which may affect groundwater, and surface waters, due to
            excessive solid wastes, lubricants, and, sanitary and
            medical wastes, in addition to contamination due to
            indiscriminate disposal of fish residues along water
            courses, all of which potentially affecting ecosystems.
            Mitigation measures are as follows. Appropriate site
            selection should determine construction sites, to be located
            at a determined distance from water flows; septic tanks
            should be available to ensure best hygienic standards;
            treatment tanks would ensure the adequate disposal of
            residues; waste management, and effluent treatment would
            ensure the appropriate utilization of biodegradable
            materials, and residues for composting activities; drainage
            systems, and water supply and sanitation networks, should be
            inspected to ensure water quality, and sewage treatment;
            replanting of native species should be practiced to prevent
            soil erosion; and, appropriate fisheries management should
            include water quality control, determining as well the
            adequate amount of aquatic life, within an optimum organic environment.
